result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. Pool

records.addlTxt:
1:24 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael L. Pool not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on bond. Warrant to be issued and defendant to be held for bond hearing. 
Court is heard, warrant to be issued and defendant to be held for bond hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on June 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:15 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael L. Pool not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on the non appearance of defendant. State requests a warrant. Requests $150.00 
Court orders warrant for defendant be held for a bond hearing.

11:50 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Michael L Pool appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause

Atty. Steiner is heard on bond - $1000.00 Signature bond with condition to have to contact with M.P.
Def. is heard on bond 

comments by defendant

Court sets bond at $1000.00 signature bond - strict compliance with bond conditions in LaCrosse Co. - No contact with M.P. directly or indirectly by telephone, mail or though another individual, except through attorney, stay away from her place of employment or residence.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  May only leave jail upon being turned over to a sober party or upon the jail determining def. is sober enough to safely leave the jail
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Def. shall have no contact with M.P. either directly or indirectly, by telephone, mail or though another individual, except through attorney, and shall stay away from her place of employment or residence.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  May only leave jail upon being turned over to a sober party or upon the jail determining def. is sober enough to safely leave the jail
